pullRequest.title: FCCEUD-45: Create the Preparing content for publication assembly
pullRequest.bodyText: Create an assembly Preparing content for publication assembly

commit.message:
FCCEUD-45: Create the Preparing content for publication assembly

* Create an assembly Preparing content for publication assembly

nodes.bodyText: Accurate, but assigning metadata also influences the URL that your doc is presented from. Maybe that still falls under the bucket of SEO? Up to you if you'd like to tweak the sentence.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,30 +1,31 @@
 [id="assigning-metadata-to-a-module_{context}"]
-= Assigning metadata to a module
+= Assigning metadata to {ContentTerm}
 
-Assign metadata to a module to enable search engine optimization (SEO). SEO improves the findability of content.
+[role="_abstract"]
+Assign metadata to {ContentTerm} to enable search engine optimization (SEO). SEO improves the findability of content.

commit.message:
FCCEUD-45: Create the Preparing content for publication assembly

* Add a sentence about metadata determining URL

beforeCommit.message:
FCCEUD-45: Create the Preparing content for publication assembly

* Add a sentence about metadata determining URL

afterCommit.message:
FCCEUD-45: Create the Preparing content for publication assembly

* Add a sentence about metadata determining URL

nodes.bodyText: We still want "a {ContentTerm}" here, don't we?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,21 +1,22 @@
 [id="previewing-modules-in-pantheon_{context}"]
-= Previewing modules in {ProductShortName}
+= Previewing {ContentTerm} in {ProductShortName}
 
-Preview a module that has been imported in {ProductShortName}. 
+[role="_abstract"]
+Preview {ContentTerm} that has been imported in {ProductShortName}.

nodes.bodyText: The meaning changes very slightly here (from "modules" to "module"). Do we have an attribute for {ContentTermPlural} or something similar?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,21 +1,22 @@
 [id="previewing-modules-in-pantheon_{context}"]
-= Previewing modules in {ProductShortName}
+= Previewing {ContentTerm} in {ProductShortName}
 
-Preview a module that has been imported in {ProductShortName}. 
+[role="_abstract"]
+Preview {ContentTerm} that has been imported in {ProductShortName}. 
 
 .Prerequisites
 * You are logged in.
 +
-If you are not logged in, you can still see the rendered module if it is already published to the customer portal.
+If you are not logged in, you can still see the rendered {ContentTerm} if it is already published to the {PublishingPortal}.
 
-* The module to be previewed has been imported in {ProductShortName}.
+* The {ContentTerm} to be previewed has been imported in {ProductShortName}.
 
 .Procedure
 . Navigate to the link:{LinkToSearchPage}[Search page].
-. Click the name of the module you want to preview.
+. Click the name of the {ContentTerm} you want to preview.
 +
-If you do not see the module listed, search for the modules using the search box.
+If you do not see the {ContentTerm} listed, search for the {ContentTerm} using the search box.

nodes.bodyText:
@theashiot
Be more specific. The way this is phrased, it's not clear that the only things you need to do to prep your content for publication is to assign metadata and preview it in the portal. It kind of begs the question..."Is there anything else I need to do?"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+
+ifdef::context[:parent-context: {context}]
+
+[id="assembly-preparing-content-for-publication_{context}"]
+= Preparing content for publication
+
+:context: assembly-preparing-content-for-publication
+
+[role="_abstract"]
+Prepare your {ContentTerm} for publication by assigning it metadata. After you assign metadata, you can preview your {ContentTerm} to see how it looks in the {PublishingPortal}.

@@ -1,30 +1,31 @@
 [id="assigning-metadata-to-a-module_{context}"]
-= Assigning metadata to a module
+= Assigning metadata to {ContentTerm}
 
-Assign metadata to a module to enable search engine optimization (SEO). SEO improves the findability of content.
+[role="_abstract"]
+Assign metadata to {ContentTerm} to enable search engine optimization (SEO). SEO improves the findability of content. Assigned metadata also determines the URL at which the {ContentTerm} is published.

nodes.bodyText:
...that has been imported into...
(rather than in)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,21 +1,22 @@
 [id="previewing-modules-in-pantheon_{context}"]
-= Previewing modules in {ProductShortName}
+= Previewing {ContentTerm} in {ProductShortName}
 
-Preview a module that has been imported in {ProductShortName}. 
+[role="_abstract"]
+Preview {ContentTerm} that has been imported in {ProductShortName}.

nodes.bodyText:
suggestion:
Change the second {ContentTerm} to it.

 .Prerequisites
 * You are logged in.
 +

 .Procedure
 . Navigate to the link:{LinkToSearchPage}[Search page].

nodes.bodyText:
Avoid future tense unless absolutely necessary, and there's no need for future tense here:
If the {ContentTerm} is already published to the {PublishingPortal}, Pantheon displays View instead of Preview.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,21 +1,22 @@
 [id="previewing-modules-in-pantheon_{context}"]
-= Previewing modules in {ProductShortName}
+= Previewing {ContentTerm} in {ProductShortName}
 
-Preview a module that has been imported in {ProductShortName}. 
+[role="_abstract"]
+Preview {ContentTerm} that has been imported in {ProductShortName}. 
 
 .Prerequisites
 * You are logged in.
 +
-If you are not logged in, you can still see the rendered module if it is already published to the customer portal.
+If you are not logged in, you can still see the rendered {ContentTerm} if it is already published to the {PublishingPortal}.
 
-* The module to be previewed has been imported in {ProductShortName}.
+* The {ContentTerm} to be previewed has been imported in {ProductShortName}.
 
 .Procedure
 . Navigate to the link:{LinkToSearchPage}[Search page].
-. Click the name of the module you want to preview.
+. Click the name of the {ContentTerm} you want to preview.
 +
-If you do not see the module listed, search for the modules using the search box.
+If you do not see the {ContentTerm} listed, search for the {ContentTerm} using the search box.
 
-. Click *Preview* next to the version of the module you want to preview.
+. Click *Preview* next to the version of the {ContentTerm} you want to preview.
 +
-If the module is already published to the Customer Portal, you will see *View* instead of *Preview*.
\ No newline at end of file
+If the {ContentTerm} is already published to the {PublishingPortal}, you will see *View* instead of *Preview*.

FCCEUD-45: Create the Preparing content for publication assembly

* Apply feedback

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+
+ifdef::context[:parent-context: {context}]
+
+[id="assembly-preparing-content-for-publication_{context}"]
+= Preparing content for publication
+
+:context: assembly-preparing-content-for-publication
+
+[role="_abstract"]
+Prepare your {ContentTerm} for publication by assigning it metadata. After you assign metadata, you can preview your {ContentTerm} to see how it looks in the {PublishingPortal}.
